alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin and north central Pike Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 100 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Conder, or near Williamson, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rural, Hatfield Station and Canada around 105 PM EDT. Whitepost and Huddy around 110 PM EDT. Forest Hills, Turkey Creek and Belfry around 115 PM EDT. Hardy around 120 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
